author: Staff Reporter
text:
Students of Savarayalu Nayagar Government Girls High School participate in the painting competition organised as part of Water Festival by All for Water for All in Puducherry on Tuesday.— Photo: S.S. Kumar

A drawing and banner painting competition was organised at the Savarayalu Nayagar Government Girls High School here on Tuesday to create awareness among students on the importance and conservation of water as part of the ongoing Water Festival in Puducherry.

Around 48 students studying between VI and X standard participated in the event depicting various emerging issues concerning water such as water scarcity, conservation and management during the event, said A. Hemavathi, headmistress of SNGGHS.

Nearly 25 schools in Puducherry region, four schools from each region including Cuddalore, Vanur, Marakkanam and Auroville have been selected for the Water Festival (February 2 to March 22).

Events include films, puppet shows, theatre, competitions and cleaning up of tanks, ponds and irrigation channels by volunteers.
title: Painting ideas for conservation of water
